pr_title: DBZ-2617 Failing heartbeats should put Postgres connector into FAILED state

timeline.message: DBZ-2617 failing heartbeats should put Postgres connector into FAILED state to allow proper shutdown of Postgres when shutdown was triggered with shutdown mode "fast"
DBZ-2617 failing heartbeats should put Postgres connector into FAILED state to allow proper shutdown of Postgres when shutdown was triggered with shutdown mode "fast"
DBZ-2617 refactor to proper HeartbeatErrorHandler injection

timeline.bodyText: I decoupled Heartbeat from the dependency to Configuration. Instead heartbeatInterval is passed explicitly (and heartbeatQuery where applicable).
timeline.author: rk3rn3r

timeline.bodyText:
@jpechane I don't think that this is a reason for a graceful shutdown of the connector. I think the connector should go into FAILED state and the user needs to resolve the Postgres issue. Then the user can simply resume the connector via Kafka Connect REST API.
cannot_connect_now can also maybe also happen during boot or reboot and might be retriable (depending on the timing). At least we can now specify the behavior per connector and maybe see how it behaves in the wild, wdyt?
timeline.author: rk3rn3r
